alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 08 at 4:00AM PST until March 12 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING ABOVE 6500 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible above 6500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 feet above 8500 feet, 1 to 2 feet between 7500 and 8500 feet including Mammoth Lakes and June Lakes, and up to 6 inches down to 6500 feet. Winds could gust as high as 120 mph along the Sierra Crest. * WHERE...Mono County. * WHEN...From Thursday afternoon through Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Higher snow levels Thursday night through Sunday brings the risk of flooding in lower elevations. See the Flood Watch for more details. In addition, there is the potential for damaging winds along the Highway 395 corridor late Thursday into Friday evening.
info.instruction: Now is the time to prepare an emergency kit for your home and car. If traveling consider alternate plans, remember to carry tire chains, extra food, water and clothing. Once the storm arrives, travel may be difficult or impossible for an extended period of time.
